gptanswer:
We have $\tan 15^\circ = \frac{1}{\tan 15^\circ} = \frac{1}{\tan^{-1}(15^\circ)} = \frac{1}{\tan^{-1}(15^\circ)}.$ We know that $\tan^{-1}(x) = \frac{1 - \cot x}{1 + \cot x},$ so $\tan^{-1}(15^\circ) = \frac{1 - \cot 15^\circ}{1 + \cot 15^\circ}.$ We can evaluate this expression by first simplifying the numerator:

\begin{align*}
\frac{1 - \cot 15^\circ}{1 + \cot 15^\circ} &= \frac{1 - \cot 15^\circ}{1 + \cot 15^\circ} \\
&= \frac{1 - \cot 15^\circ}{1 + \cot 15^\circ} \\
&= \frac{1 - \cot 15^\circ}{1 + \cot 15^\circ} \\
&= \frac{1 - \cot 15^\circ}{1 - \cot 15^\circ} \\
&= \frac{1 - \cot 15^\circ}{-\cot 15^\circ} \\
&= \frac{1 - \cot 15^\circ}{-1} \\
&= \boxed{1}.
\end{align*}
